website_summaries.verdict: An ideal light meter for professional and hobbyists photographers or videographers.
pros: Extremely sensitive and accurate light readings
Stores different data and peak readings on command for note taking
cons: Has a cheap, plastic feel around the light sensor and main body of the device
Does not read all types of lights

customer_reviews.title: Clunky but it works
customer_reviews.text: 9V batteries like to die when not in use. So I remove mine. There is a screw over that door so I have one screw loose ;-) Seriously, it does work. But the coiled cord to the sensor is a little short. And they way the dome cover works, you find yourself trying to hold something like a squirming animal trying to take readings. Would be better if the dome cover snapped off instead of a little chain holding it on. Even a flip over design would be better. It does work, is more accurate than an app on your phone. But a little more design care would go a LONG way.
customer_reviews.author: inayat2012 on youtube

customer_reviews.title: Good news is the other 2 LED lights I bought ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to measure some LED flood lights I bought, that didn't seem to be as bright as advertised. Measured the light, converted LUX to lumens, and sure enough, LED flood light was only 72% of what was advertised. I sent it back. Good news is the other 2 LED lights I bought came in at 92% of advertised, and the other was 112% of advertised. Bottom line..... meter did what I needed, it is very well built, easy to operate and comes with a hard carrying case. Great product.... great value!
customer_reviews.author: jacobsenrp

customer_reviews.title: very informative
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get a feeling for environmental light levels. I did not get it for photography so I don't need the exposure/f stop information of some light meters. The product is easy to use. But, I don't have any idea how accurate it is. Light levels fluctuate on a log scale so the readings vary tremendously. Most informative is the fact that you can see quite well below one lumen. I put it in a closet to get below one lumen. And I went outside and pointed it at the Sun for a billion lumens. Very wide operating range.
customer_reviews.author: kikeo58

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to measure the light levels in our house to see what skylights would do. I can't speak to its accuracy, but it was very consistent in taking measurements. Having the sensor separate from the main unit is a big plus - I was able to take readings on the roof and some other tight places yet still read the results easily.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. If you're an electrician or in the lighting business, this is a must have as the electrical code mandates how much illumination certain areas of a building must have. If you're a photographer, this is NOT what you're looking for. This light meter gives you the amount of light in LUX and candle powers...no information at all about the f/stop or ISO or anything like that ;)
customer_reviews.author: Doctor C

customer_reviews.title: Good quality build

customer_reviews.title: How much light am I really getting?  I found out.
customer_reviews.text: Handy meter. Reads either LUX or foot-candles. Comes with storage case. Direct sunlight coming through southern window read 50,000 LUX in early March (Northern Indiana). With the upper range at 200,000 LUX, it should cover all my lighting needs. Used mainly to check lighting around house plants. Easy to read, large digits. Came with 9-volt battery. Up and running as soon as battery installed.

customer_reviews.title: I now have a yardstick by which to measure LED lighting performance at the work surface. Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to measure the amount of light actually landing on a work surface vs. that at the source. I could see that there was a difference in the illumination under the 75 watt halogen flood lights in my kitchen vs. the any of the LED replacement lights I tried, but I couldn't quantify it until now. Using this meter I measured the LUX at the counter level and saw that reading under the supposedly equivalent LED was as much as 400 LUX less than the halogen. Now I have a yardstick by which to measure LED lighting performance and report in same in future reviews of LED lights I experiment with here at Amazon. Perfect!

customer_reviews.title: Great meter, no issues so far

I will be able to use it to find the right distance and also to tell me when my bulbs are going bad. customer_reviews.text: You need to access the battery to get started. Take the orange cover off. It is robber material so it slips out easy like a glove. At the bottom back, access the battery. Take the plastic off the battery then plug it in. Turn it on. Works great! Easy to use!

customer_reviews.title: Narrow spectral response - can provide misleading information
customer_reviews.text: Spectral response is very narrow - some LEDs are not measured accurately. Utilitech (Lowe's house brand) dimmable LEDs will be measured artificially low since their light output is not at the right frequency for this meter. Phillips brand LEDs do not seem to cause the same problem. Incandescent and traditional fluorescent lights seem to be measured normally. Keep these limitations in mind when measuring lighting levels.

customer_reviews.title: Reads accurate, good unit for the price
customer_reviews.text: I compare the readings of this unit with more professional meters and it seems to be pretty close. Read the other reviews for more specific details. I give it a two thumbs up for the price.

customer_reviews.title: Because of the good reviews and low price
customer_reviews.text: My son needed a light meter for his science project. Because of the good reviews and low price, I picked this one. I have no experience with light meters, but this one was easy to understand and gave consistent readings. this is embarrassing to admit, but figuring out where the battery goes was the only problem. I thought I was going to break it when I finally pulled the orange covering off, but there it was :) The battery was still in the clear packaging, so that has to be removed and the battery connected. then we were in business!
